Articles.Content:
I just fired up a new game, playing it permadeath style.

Of course Jeb, silly lil nutjob that he is, was first up for an ORBIT ONLY of Kerbin. Got up there just fine. Looked at his fuel gauge, waves a cheery farewell to the space center and promptly plots a free return orbit round the mun at an altitude of approx 6k or so at PE. While scoping out the scenery, he spots an arch on the east side of a large crater in a somewhat smaller crater shaped somewhat like a teardrop. Naturally, not quite believing it, he rubbed his eyes and looked again, yep still there. Dang, forgot the camera.. Couldn't wait to get back into radio range to report this amazing find, but low and behold, along the north edge of another large crater (and this is the one I am familiar with) he spots another. A 2fer.

Upon returning to kerbin and reporting these amazing things to the space center, which they listened to with some skepticism, they decided to launch a few probes to shut him up about it. Probes are currently in route.

Upshot is, has anyone else ever run across a second arch on the mun? Is it just an occasional glitch?
These things and more wonders await you on the surface of Mun.

There are actually three different Mun arches on the Mun, and they are not glitches.

Edited June 2, 2013 by rryy
Hid the number to prevent spoilers.
I did not know that.. See, I learned something new today
